style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier

breweries.description: Two words: cool & dark. Schmohz Ales and Lagers, like many quality craft beers, are not pasteurized. While this helps them taste fresher and more full-flavored, it also means that extended exposure to warm temperatures may cause them (especially if they are unfiltered) to taste, well, less fresh. So keep 'em cool! As for the dark part, let's just say that sunlight can negatively affect some brews (it makes 'em smell "skunky"). That's why we put our beers in light-blocking brown bottles and take extra caution to keep them out of the way of direct sunlight.
breweries.name: Schmohz Brewing Company

style.description: These very dark brown to black beers have a mild roasted malt character without the associated bitterness. This is not a fullbodied beer, but rather a moderate body gently enhances malt flavor and aroma with low to moderate levels of sweetness. Hop bitterness is low to medium in character. Noble-type hop flavor and aroma should be low but perceptible. There should be no fruity esters. Diacetyl should not be perceived.
style.name: German-Style Schwarzbier

breweries.description: With more than 30 years of fermentation experience and an award-winning reputation in the industry, our line of hand-crafted brews embody the satisfying bold taste you've come to expect from The Round Barn.
breweries.name: The Round Barn Winery & Brewery

style.description: Dry stouts have an initial malt and light caramel flavor profile with a distinctive dry-roasted bitterness in the finish. Dry stouts achieve a dry-roasted character through the use of roasted barley. The emphasis of coffee-like roasted barley and a moderate degree of roasted malt aromas define much of the character. Some slight acidity may be perceived but is not necessary. European hop aroma and flavor should be low or not perceived. Dry stouts have medium-light to medium body. Fruity esters are minimal and overshadowed by malt, high hop bitterness, and roasted barley character. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be very low or not perceived. Head retention and rich character should be part of its visual character.
style.name: Classic Irish-Style Dry Stout

breweries.description: 2012 GREAT AMERICAN BEER FESTIVAL SMALL BREWPUB and SMALL BREWPUB BREWER OF THE YEAR & 2010 WORLD BEER CUP CHAMPION BREWERY & SMALL BREWPUB, the award winning Basecamp Brewpub is situated in the majestic valley of the Blue Ridge Mountains with a lodge style atmosphere. We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too!  Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.

locations.hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday open 1pm - 7pm.  Friday & Saturday open 1pm - 8pm.  Sunday open 1pm - 6pm
locations.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company - Outpost

breweries.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company

description:
Black in color with a subtle roasted flavor of fine toasted malts. Lager yeast creates a quick and dry finish. 

2010 World Beer Cup Bronze
2012 Virginia Craft Brewers Fest Gold
2013 Virginia Craft Brewers Fest Gold
2014 Great American Festival Gold
2014 Virginia Craft Brewers Fest Bronze

breweries.description: Golden Road is a brewery located in Los Angeles, California.  Founders Tony Yanow and Meg Gill share a vision to bring fresh beer to locals, bolstering the greater LA craft community.  Located off of the 5 freeway, north of downtown, our pub is open daily, offering great food and a wide variety of our latest brews.

locations.hoursOfOperation: Monday - Sunday: 11AM-11PM
locations.name: Pub

breweries.name: Golden Road Brewing

description: In celebration of our founding partner's 70th birthday, we brewed his favorite style of beer: a clean and true nitro stout. With the perfect mouth-feel and head, stemming from a unique tradition of a nitrogen tap, this 4.5% ABV stout will surprise you in lightness. While mild in aroma, the malt complexities of this beer deserve to be slowly savored to reach its true flavor potential. Like nitro beers? Enjoy dark beers? You'll love our take on Schwartz's beer.

style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.
style.name: American-Style Stout

name: Schwartz Stout

breweries.description:
It has been said that America’s Brewing Company is the epitome to the American Brewing Tradition; not just creating quality, handcrafted, small-batch brews but creating beers that have won three consecutive Gold Medals at the World Beer Cup Competitions.

In the 20th century (1996) the Roundhouse started bottling the Payton Pilsner, Honey Wheat and Rootbeer.  Now in the 21st century (2009), the beer selection has increased enormously!  Because you asked for it, now the Roundhouse also bottles: Payton Pilsner Light and Aurora Amber Ale.  This diverse selection of beer is now available not only in six-packs, but in four-packs as well.  Now you can enjoy...
breweries.name: America's Brewing Company

style.description: These very dark brown to black beers have a mild roasted malt character without the associated bitterness. This is not a fullbodied beer, but rather a moderate body gently enhances malt flavor and aroma with low to moderate levels of sweetness. Hop bitterness is low to medium in character. Noble-type hop flavor and aroma should be low but perceptible. There should be no fruity esters. Diacetyl should not be perceived.

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

breweries.description:
We are a small artisan brewery located in McMinnville, Oregon.  We specialize in producing distinctive all-malt lager and other German and Czech style beers.  We use only the finest, most appropriate malts, hops, water and yeast in our beers.  While our lagers are similar to those made in Germany, they are our own unique interpretation of the style. 

Lager beers are fermented at lower temperatures than ale, using yeast that has adapted to cooler fermentations.  Low temperature fermentations create fewer “yeasty” aromas, esters, and flavors that are so common in ales.  We brew lagers because we enjoy their smooth malty and hoppy character.

locations.hoursOfOperation: If you'd like to stop by the Brewery, either come by on a brew day, usually Tuesdays and Fridays (check the calendar for a complete list of brew days) or call us during the week (we rarely check messages on the weekend) to schedule an appointment.
locations.name: Main Brewery

breweries.name: Heater Allen Brewery

description: I recently changed this recipe to drop the smoked malt component to 8% from 12%, and I like it even better than the last version.  I think I'm back in real Schwarzbier territory now, especially after reading more about the dark beers of old Eastern Europe.  The beer's aroma is malty/espresso, with a hint of smoke.  On the palate, malt, chocolate and espresso flavors take center stage, along with a hint of smoke.  The sweet smokiness just offsets the more bitter/roasty notes, producing a smooth, rich brew.  The hops provide balance, but virtually nothing to the aroma.  This is the perfect beer to serve with a barbecued steak or tri-tip.  It's also excellent with just about any chocolate dessert!

description: Schwarz, German for “black beer”, our Schwarz is a very refreshing and soul lifting beer—a great alternative for the winter. Especially when you are looking for a “lighter” beer, but one with depth of color and taste.

breweries.description:
The Blowing Rock Brewery and Ale House Restaurant is located in downtown Blowing Rock. A state-of-the-art brewing system consists of a 5 barrel Mash Tun, Brew Kettle and 10 barrel Fermenters & Brights . The brewery offers an impressive variety of craft beers brewed by master brewer, Ray Hodge. The Blowing Rock Ale House restaurant offers a freshly prepared, seasonally changing menu using local & organic ingredients when available. 64 ounce “growler” fills of freshly brewed beer are offered daily, with brewery tours 1:00-5:30pm Saturdays. We hope you will join us for lunch & dinner, 11am-9pm.

152 Sunset Drive
Blowing Rock, NC 28605-1236
Telephone: 828-414-9600 
http://blowingrockbrewing.com/
breweries.name: Blowing Rock Brewery

description: Our Schwartz is a dark, German lager full of a traditional dark beer flavor, but with less of a heavy-bodied feel. This brew has a mildly roasted malt character and flavors of both caramel and toffee. First produced in Saxony, Germany, the Schwartz Bier is believed to have been consumed since the Middle Ages.

breweries.description: We’ve been brewing ales, lagers, and sours in Bloomington, Indiana since 1998. Many of our brews are unique twists on traditional recipes, while others are products of our own imaginations. We’re proud to say that several of our beers have brought home national and international medals and awards, but what we really care about is brewing the kinds of beer we like to drink, and providing a fresh local option to our communities. It never hurts to get a pat on the back, though! Along the way, we’ve made lots of friends and drank our unfair share of good beer, all while trying to do good in our communities and do well as a craft brewery.

locations.hoursOfOperation:
Upland offers free tours from 3-5 pm every Saturday and Sunday.

Brewpub:
pen 11:00am until midnight Monday through Thursday
Open 11:00am until 1:00am Friday and Saturday
Open noon until midnight Sunday
locations.name: Main Brewery

breweries.name: Upland Brewing Company

description:
Schwarzbier (black beer) originated in medieval Germany, and though Upland isn’t quite that old, we strive to bring you an authentic version of this historic beer. Our take on this ancient lager delivers hints of chocolate and coffee, courtesy of its dark malts, with a strong nose and a clean finish, striking the right balance of robust and crisp, with enough bitterness to accentuate but, not overpower, its many subtle flavors.

Don’t be fooled by Schwarz’s dark color! This beer may look ferocious, but it’s as smooth as any golden lager. Schwarz is a great beer to enjoy when the days get cold.

style.description: These very dark brown to black beers have a mild roasted malt character without the associated bitterness. breweries.description:
Stumblefoot Brewing Co. has set out to make some of the most interesting styles of beer we can think of. We want our beer to be an artisan experience of local flavor. 

Stumblefoot Brewery is in its second year of joining the ranks of new breweries. We have setup in San Diego's North County - in San Marcos, CA. This area has become known as a mecca for beer. And all you need to do be a part of it is ... Represent!

Stumblefoot is a name that personifies the boot strap and prototyping format we have gone about creating our brewery. The name pays tribute to our willingness to experiment.

We decided to come up with a definition that incorporates the essence of our experience:
Stumblefoot – \’stəm • bəl • fut\ (noun) 
1) The art and science of gaining new knowledge through the happenstance of interesting encounters. Fortune favors the prepared.
See also: Organic, sharing, open-minded, kismet, lucky

description: This Schwarzbier (black lager) was made with our house lager yeast and debittered black malt to make a smooth, roasty base beer. We add a ½ lb per gallon of blackberries to give a subtle hint of tart fruit.

breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!
breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co

style.description: This beer's malt aroma and flavor are low but notable. Its color ranges from a very deep copper to a deep, dark brown. It has a clean, light body with discreet contributions from caramel and roasted malts. Non-malt adjuncts are often used, and hop rates are low. Hop bitterness is clean and has a short duration of impact. Hop flavor, and aroma are low. Carbonation is high. Fruity esters, diacetyl, and chill haze should not be perceived.
style.name: American-Style Dark Lager

name: Schwarzberry

description: Our Schwarzbier, or “Black Lager,” is a refreshing take on “dark” beer. A traditional schwarzbier is essentially the recipe for a light colored lager with just enough dark malt to turn is a beautiful ruby-tinged black. Expect a touch of roast character to accompany this crisp and malty beer. Unlike a traditional stout, our schwarzbier finishes light and bready.

breweries.description: Blue Stallion Brewing Co. is the newest craft brewery in Lexington, Kentucky. We make the finest German lagers and British Ales focusing on traditional brewing techniques and ingredients. We want to bring Lexington an experience in beer not available anywhere else.
breweries.name: Blue Stallion Brewing Company

breweries.description: In 1997, Gordon Biersch opened a state-of-the-art brewery and bottling facility in San Jose, CA in order to begin bottling and distributing its famed, German-style beers. Today, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company is a brewing industry leader with 22 years of experience and counting. The microbrew trend continues to grow, and the company is actively expanding its distribution nationwide. Since 1998, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company has more than doubled its production, increasing its capacity to 3.1 million gallons of beer annually, making Gordon Biersch Brewing Company the largest brewery in the San Francisco Bay Area.

breweries.description:
The Rohrbach Brewing Company has been brewing handcrafted ales and lagers in Rochester for over a decade! Loyal Rohrbach customers from near and far continue to prove that there is a market for premium high quality lagers and ales.

All of our ales and lagers are made with only the finest ingredients available worldwide; two-row malted barley from Belgium and the freshest hops from Europe and the Pacific Northwest . Our lagers and ales are delivered cold and fresh, with no artificial preservatives or flavor deteriorating pasteurization, which insures that your customers enjoy them at their peak freshness.

breweries.description: Hereford and Hops opened in downtown Escanaba, on the first floor of a historic 1914 five-story former hotel. The restored building has two dining rooms, a pub and two brick open grills. Since 1994 Hereford and Hops has specialized in a do-it-yourself style of dining with the choice to grill your own steak, seafood or chicken. With grill chefs on duty, you can always choose to have your entrée professionally grilled.

description: A German inspired light-bodied black ale dominated by roasty burnt caramel and toffee notes. Northwest hops add a non-traditional citrus and resin character to result in a rich, yet surprisingly light and smooth dark ale.

breweries.description:
Our beers are European-inspired and uniquely sessionable – designed to showcase deep flavors in an approachable package. Using unfiltered Snoqualmie Pass mountain water, imported German malts and Yakima Valley hops we craft beers that are distinctly Dru Bru.

We offer a warm welcome, a wealth of beer knowledge and wide variety styles brewed in our adjoining 15 barrel brewhouse. Our taproom is open year round so park your skis, boards, bikes, packs or cars and gather around something great.

All ages welcome.
breweries.name: Dru Bru

style.description: These very dark brown to black beers have a mild roasted malt character without the associated bitterness. This is not a fullbodied beer, but rather a moderate body gently enhances malt flavor and aroma with low to moderate levels of sweetness. Hop bitterness is low to medium in character. Noble-type hop flavor and aroma should be low but perceptible. There should be no fruity esters. Diacetyl should not be perceived.
style.name: German-Style Schwarzbier

name: SCHWARZBIER

breweries.description: Live Oak Brewing Company is truly a home-grown Austin enterprise. Two of Austin's own homebrews, Chip McElroy and Brian Peters, literally hand-built the brewery and were the two main brewers, keg washers, delivery persons, and proselytizers. Live Oak has grown since then, but we are still just as passionate about providing delicious old-world style beers that are rarely commercially available. Our special beers are brewed in limited quantities in a small east Austin brewery and are available in fine pubs and restaurants in Austin, Dallas, Houston, Alpine, Marathon, San Marcos and San Antonio.
breweries.name: Live Oak Brewing Company

description: Schwarzbier is an opaque black lager that reveals deep ruby undertones in the light. Munich, Pilsner and Black Malt flavors play off the flowery, spicy notes of Noble German hops. Cold fermentation and conditioning with Bavarian lager yeast assures a clean draught with a dry finish. We are extraordinarily pleased to present this exceptional specialty lager.

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

breweries.description: Bayern Brewing began in Missoula, Montana, in 1987. We are proud to be the only German brewery in the Rocky Mountains. Owner and Brewmaster, Jürgen Knöller, is a German Diploma Master Brewer. He began brewing in 1978 at age 16. The education that he received in Germany was a rigorous and lengthy one. It took eight years to advance from apprentice to journeyman to Master brewer. He focuses on quality and is truly dedicated to his profession. Combine his education, experience and personal dedication and you have amazing beer.
breweries.name: Bayern Brewing

description: Enjoy the smooth and light taste of this classic German Black Lager brewed with four types of malt (Schwarz, Munich, Cara Munich and Pale), Hallertauler Perle hops from Germany and the care and experience from the only German brewery in the Rocky mountains. Schwarzbier is mild and balanced and doesn't have the bite of dark ales. Its alcohol content of 5.0% vol. makes it perfect to enjoy year round. Come, all you dark beer fans - experience the Dark Side of Bayern and why German beer has the reputation as the best beer in the world.

style.description: These very dark brown to black beers have a mild roasted malt character without the associated bitterness. name: Schwarzbier

description: Dark lager with a mild, malty flavor and smooth finish.

breweries.description: In the 1870s, Cleveland had 30 breweries. By the early 1980s, the last one had shuttered its doors. So when brothers Patrick and Daniel Conway opened Great Lakes Brewing Company on September 6, 1988, it not only signaled a new era in Cleveland brewing, it was also the first microbrewery in the state of Ohio. And the idea of a craft brewery in Cleveland caught on fast, as curious patrons hurried in for a pint crafted in the styles of old and drawn from the taps of the beautiful Victorian era bar. The company's commitment to sustainable business practices greatly contributed to its early popularity and success. Before long, Great Lakes Brewing Company had become one of Cleveland's most popular destinations for both dining and a fun night out.

style.description: This beer's malt aroma and flavor are low but notable. Its color ranges from a very deep copper to a deep, dark brown. It has a clean, light body with discreet contributions from caramel and roasted malts. Non-malt adjuncts are often used, and hop rates are low. Hop bitterness is clean and has a short duration of impact. Hop flavor, and aroma are low. Carbonation is high. Fruity esters, diacetyl, and chill haze should not be perceived.
style.name: American-Style Dark Lager

name: Schwarzbier

description: A dark German lager, this beer is well balanced and surprisingly smooth.  With little to no residual hop bitterness this is a great winter thirst quencher!

breweries.description: The Square One Brewery & Distillery began operations as a brewery /restaurant in February of 2006. In August of 2008 Square One became the first microdistillery restaurant in the state of Missouri and one of the first in the country. We believe that our approach to the alcohol beverage program is unique and very different from that of other restaurants. We believe in crafting the products we serve whether it is spirits, beer or food. By combining the expertise of our distiller, our master brewer, and our chef we are committed to creating an amazing array of flavors and tastes for our customers.

A smooth, tasty, light-bodied, black German lager.

Silver Medal 2010 World Beer Cup
Bronze Medal 2010 Great American Beer Festival

breweries.description:
TAPS Fish House & Brewery was founded in 1999. Many of our beers reflect the classic brewing traditions of Europe, including England, Germany, and Belgium, while others are indicative of the creativity and innovation that are the hallmarks of the American Craft Beer scene.

TAPS’ repertoire of ales and lagers is highly varied and reflects a nod to tradition with a focus on perfection and innovation. The brewing team produces approximately 3000 kegs, or 46,500 gallons of beer annually. Our brewers supply TAPS in Brea, Corona and Irvine, as well as our sister restaurants, The Catch in Anaheim and Lillie’s Q in Brea Downtown. TAPS also distributes fine beers to restaurants and pubs throughout Southern California. We have received national and international acclaim for barrel-aging programs, which produce cult classics such as Remy’s Pappy.

We source the finest ingredients from around the world and utilize the best brewing procedures to create truly great beer: “World Class in Every Glass.” The hops and barley are meticulously sourced in order to emulate the fine beers and brewing regions of the world.  We utilize proprietary strains of yeast, reverse osmosis filtration, and tailor our water chemistry and processes every time beer is made.

TAPS’ passion for perfection has been recognized on the regional, state, national and international levels—to date we have received over 87 medals for our fine beers. TAPS barrel-aged products have also garnered national and international acclaim and are treasured by collectors worldwide

description: Our nod to the traditional German black lager, produced with old-world step-mashing methods. Well-balanced, it features the coloring of a stout or porter but with a restrained black malt flavor. This beer is smooth and deceptively complex.

breweries.description: Fair State Brewing Cooperative is Minnesota's first and only cooperatively-owned brewery, where you can truly drink like you own the place. We concentrate on brewing high quality hoppy, German, and sour beers that bring a unique collective perspective to Minnesota's craft beer world, creating beer of the people, for the people.
breweries.name: Fair State Brewing Cooperative

description: German lager built on pilsner base malt and a few specialty malts, made black with Midnight Wheat malt. Hopped with Hallertau and fermented with the Weihenstephan 206 strain.

breweries.description:
We’re small, but who knew when we took on the tagline of Competing for the title of Portland’s Smallest Brewery that we’d actually also qualify as Oregon’s Smallest Brewery. (At least for 2011, based on sales volume.)

But our size isn’t quite the whole story. For now, it will suffice to say that we’re passionate about creating tasty beers that surprise you with their simplicity. Beers that we hope people LOVE to drink. Brewed in small batches.

Thank you for your interest! We hope you get the chance to try one of our beers and appreciate your support.
breweries.name: Humble Brewing

description: One of the traditional old German style lagers. This is a black lager with a toasty profile. It is lighter in body than a stout and can be clean and refreshing with very satisfying coffee and malt flavors in the finish.
